metadata.title: Automated Workflows for Top 5 Most Profitable Finance AI SaaS Ideas
metadata.description: End-to-end automated workflow definitions for the highest-scoring problem statements, designed for AI-native product implementation.
metadata.selection_criteria: Profitability Score ≥ 9, ranked by TAM × pain intensity × competitive gap

top_5_selection.title: The CIM Factory (Agency Model)
top_5_selection.why_most_profitable: Immediate path to $20k/mo cash flow. Solves 'Trust' issue by delivering result first. Pays for SaaS R&D.

top_5_selection.title: Deal Scouting Engine (Data Service)
top_5_selection.why_most_profitable: High leverage. Build once, sell data to multiple non-competing firms. Massive upside via success fees.

top_5_selection.title: Universal Financial Data Extraction Engine (SaaS)
top_5_selection.competitive_moat: Battle-tested on real Agency deals first
top_5_selection.why_most_profitable: Infrastructure layer. Built in background while Agency generates cash.

top_5_selection.title: CRE Underwriting Automation
top_5_selection.competitive_moat: AI rent-roll extraction + auto pro forma
top_5_selection.why_most_profitable: Future expansion once Agency brand is established.

profitability_analysis.strategic_insight: Pivot to Agency Model (CIM Factory) solves the Cold Start problem. Revenue funds R&D. Data from Agency work trains the SaaS models.

WF-001.workflow_type: Document Intelligence → Risk Analysis → Report Generation
WF-001.trigger: Data room URL/access credentials provided by deal team

stages.name: Data Room Ingestion & Classification
stages.description: Automatically crawl VDR, download all documents, classify by DD category
ai_tasks: OCR and text extraction from all document formats (PDF, DOCX, XLSX, images)
Document classification using fine-tuned classifier (Legal, Financial, Tax, HR, IP, Environmental, etc.)
Duplicate detection and version tracking
Completeness assessment against standard DD checklist
Gap identification — flag missing document categories

stages.name: Financial Data Extraction & Spreading
stages.description: Extract structured financial data from all financial documents
ai_tasks: Extract income statement, balance sheet, cash flow data from PDF financials
Normalize across different reporting standards (GAAP, IFRS, local GAAP)
Identify non-recurring items and one-time adjustments
Build historical financial database (3-5 years)
Calculate key financial metrics and ratios automatically
Quality of earnings (QoE) initial analysis

stages.name: Contract & Legal Analysis
stages.description: Extract key terms, obligations, and risks from legal documents
ai_tasks: Extract key clauses from all contracts (term, termination, change of control, exclusivity, non-compete)
Identify material contracts vs. standard agreements
Flag unusual or non-market terms
Map customer/supplier concentration from contract data
Analyze litigation exposure from legal filings
Identify regulatory compliance gaps

stages.name: Cross-Reference & Anomaly Detection
stages.description: Cross-validate findings across document types and flag inconsistencies
ai_tasks: Cross-reference financial data with contract terms (revenue vs. customer contracts)
Identify discrepancies between management representations and documentation
Flag material changes between periods
Detect potential liabilities not disclosed in financials
Calculate adjusted EBITDA with AI-suggested adjustments
Risk-weight findings by materiality

stages.name: DD Report Generation
stages.description: Generate structured due diligence report with findings, risks, and recommendations
inputs: All extracted data and analyses from Stages 1-4
ai_tasks: Generate executive summary with key findings
Create section-by-section DD report (Financial, Legal, Tax, HR, IT, Environmental)
Produce risk heat map visualization
Generate deal-breaker alerts for critical findings
Create appendices with supporting data tables
Format to client's brand template

human_review_checkpoints: Post Stage 1: Validate document classification accuracy
Post Stage 2: Review financial spreading and QoE assumptions
Post Stage 4: Confirm anomaly significance and materiality thresholds
Post Stage 5: Final report review and sign-off

WF-002.workflow_type: Data Ingestion → Model Construction → Scenario Analysis → Lender Reporting
WF-002.trigger: Project term sheet or information memorandum uploaded

stages.name: Project Data Extraction & Structuring
stages.description: Extract project parameters from term sheets, IMs, and contracts
ai_tasks: Extract project type (renewable energy, transport, social infrastructure, data center)
Identify key financial parameters (construction cost, debt/equity split, tenor, interest rates)
Parse tariff/revenue structure from concession/PPA documents
Extract construction timeline and milestone schedule
Identify currency exposures from multi-currency contracts
Map regulatory/permitting requirements

stages.name: Automated Model Construction
stages.description: Build project finance model framework from extracted parameters
ai_tasks: Select appropriate base model template by project type
Auto-populate construction cost budget and drawdown schedule
Build revenue model based on tariff/PPA structure
Construct operating expense model with escalation assumptions
Build debt sculpting engine matching cash flow profile to DSCR targets
Handle circular references (interest ↔ cash flow) programmatically
Build tax model with jurisdiction-specific rules
Create multi-currency cashflow consolidation

stages.name: Scenario & Sensitivity Analysis
stages.description: Run automated scenario analyses and sensitivity tables
ai_tasks: Run base case, upside, downside, and bankable case scenarios
Generate sensitivity tables (DSCR, IRR, LLCR vs. key variables)
Perform Monte Carlo simulation on key risk variables
Calculate breakeven analysis on critical assumptions
Stress test for construction delay, cost overrun, revenue shortfall
Generate tornado charts showing sensitivity ranking

stages.name: Lender Presentation & Reporting
stages.description: Generate lender-ready outputs and presentations
ai_tasks: Generate financial model summary pack
Create lender presentation with key metrics (DSCR, LLCR, PLCR, equity IRR)
Build model audit trail documenting all assumptions
Generate covenant compliance tracker
Create term sheet comparison matrix (if multiple lender proposals)
Auto-format to lender/sponsor brand standards

human_review_checkpoints: Post Stage 1: Validate extracted parameters against source documents
Post Stage 2: Review model logic, debt sculpting, and key assumptions
Post Stage 3: Review scenario ranges and stress test parameters
Post Stage 4: Final model sign-off before lender distribution

WF-003.workflow_type: Data Gathering → Content Synthesis → Document Generation → Brand Formatting
WF-003.trigger: New sell-side mandate engagement letter signed

stages.name: Multi-Source Data Ingestion
stages.description: Automatically gather and organize all source data for CIM creation
ai_tasks: Crawl and index client data room contents
Extract financial data from statements and reports
Pull public company data from SEC filings (if applicable)
Scrape market data, industry reports, and competitor information from APIs
Extract key business information from management presentations
Organize visual assets (logos, product images, facility photos)

stages.name: Content Synthesis & Draft Generation
stages.description: Generate first draft of all CIM sections
ai_tasks: Generate executive summary with investment highlights
Draft company overview (history, products, operations)
Synthesize industry overview and market dynamics section
Create growth strategy and opportunity narrative
Build financial summary with historical/projected tables
Draft management team bios and organizational overview
Generate risk factors section
Create transaction summary and process timeline

stages.name: Financial Spreading & Visualization
stages.description: Build financial exhibits and charts for the CIM
ai_tasks: Build formatted financial summary tables (P&L, BS, CF)
Generate financial charts (revenue growth, margin trends, EBITDA bridge)
Create customer/revenue concentration analysis visuals
Build peer benchmarking charts
Generate market size and growth visualizations
Format all exhibits to bank brand standards

stages.name: Brand Formatting & Assembly
stages.description: Apply bank branding and assemble final CIM document
ai_tasks: Apply bank's brand template (fonts, colors, headers, footers)
Position visual assets and charts within document flow
Generate table of contents and page numbers
Apply consistent formatting across all sections
Create PDF and Word versions
Generate version tracking metadata

stages.name: Review Tracking & Iteration
stages.description: Manage review workflow and implement revisions
ai_tasks: Track reviewer comments and suggested changes
Auto-implement formatting-only changes
Flag substantive changes for human review
Maintain revision history and comparison views
Generate change summary between versions
Re-apply brand formatting after content changes

human_review_checkpoints: Post Stage 1: Validate data completeness and accuracy
Post Stage 2: Review narrative quality and investment thesis framing
Post Stage 3: Verify financial exhibit accuracy

WF-004.workflow_type: Document Extraction → Pro Forma Build → Scenario Analysis → Investment Memo
WF-004.trigger: Offering Memorandum / Rent Roll PDF uploaded

stages.name: OM & Rent Roll Extraction
stages.description: Extract structured data from offering memorandum and rent roll PDFs
ai_tasks: Extract property-level details (address, year built, square footage, unit mix)
Parse rent roll: tenant name, suite, SF, monthly/annual rent, lease start/end, escalations, options
Extract asking price, cap rate, and broker assumptions
Identify property type and select appropriate underwriting template
Extract historical operating statements (T-12, T-3 financials)
Parse comparable sales and rental comps from OM

stages.name: Pro Forma Model Generation
stages.description: Auto-build pro forma cash flow model from extracted data
ai_tasks: Build lease-by-lease cash flow projection (5-10 year hold period)
Model lease expirations and re-leasing assumptions using market comps
Project operating expenses with appropriate growth rates by category
Model capital expenditure reserves and tenant improvement allowances
Calculate NOI, Cash Flow, and net operating income projections
Size debt based on DSCR and LTV constraints
Calculate leveraged and unleveraged returns (IRR, equity multiple, cash-on-cash)

stages.name: Market Comp Analysis & Validation
stages.description: Validate assumptions against market data and comparable transactions
ai_tasks: Pull comparable sales data for the submarket
Benchmark rent assumptions against market comps
Validate cap rate assumption against recent transactions
Compare expense ratios to market benchmarks
Flag any assumptions that deviate significantly from market norms
Generate comp adjustment analysis

stages.name: Scenario Analysis & Stress Testing
stages.description: Run scenario and sensitivity analyses on the pro forma
ai_tasks: Run base case, bull case, bear case scenarios
Build sensitivity tables (IRR vs. exit cap rate vs. rent growth)
Stress test for vacancy spike, cap rate expansion, rent decline
Model refinancing scenarios at different LTV/rate assumptions
Calculate breakeven occupancy and breakeven rent levels
Generate scenario comparison dashboard

stages.name: Investment Memo Generation
stages.description: Generate investment committee memo from all analyses
ai_tasks: Generate executive summary with investment thesis
Create property overview section with key facts
Draft market overview with submarket analysis
Summarize financial analysis with key return metrics
List key risks and mitigants
Create appendices with supporting detail
Format to firm's IC memo template

human_review_checkpoints: Post Stage 1: Validate rent roll extraction accuracy
Post Stage 2: Review pro forma assumptions and return calculations
Post Stage 3: Confirm market comp relevance
Post Stage 5: IC memo sign-off before presentation

WF-005.workflow_type: Document Ingestion → AI Extraction → Normalization → Output
WF-005.trigger: Financial document uploaded (PDF, scan, filing URL) via API or UI

stages.name: Document Ingestion & Pre-Processing
stages.description: Accept any financial document format and prepare for extraction
inputs: Financial document (PDF, scanned image, XBRL, DOCX, Excel)
ai_tasks: Detect document type (10-K, 10-Q, annual report, audited financials, management accounts, OM)
OCR processing for scanned documents
Layout analysis to identify tables, text blocks, headers
Language detection for international documents
Page segmentation to isolate financial statements from narrative
Quality score assessment (readability, completeness)

stages.name: Financial Statement Extraction
stages.description: Extract all financial line items from identified statements
ai_tasks: Identify and extract Income Statement (revenue, COGS, opex, EBITDA, net income)
Identify and extract Balance Sheet (assets, liabilities, equity line items)
Identify and extract Cash Flow Statement (operating, investing, financing)
Extract footnotes and supplementary schedules
Handle multi-period statements (quarterly, annual, YTD)
Extract segment-level financial breakdowns
Capture currency and unit denominations

stages.name: Normalization & Standardization
stages.description: Normalize extracted data to a standard chart of accounts
ai_tasks: Map company-specific line items to standardized taxonomy
Handle accounting standard differences (GAAP vs. IFRS)
Normalize currency to base currency with historical FX rates
Standardize fiscal period alignment
Calculate derived metrics (gross margin, EBITDA margin, leverage ratios, etc.)
Flag non-recurring items for adjustment
Build time-series database across multiple periods

stages.name: Validation & Quality Assurance
stages.description: Validate extracted data for accuracy and completeness
ai_tasks: Balance sheet balance check (A = L + E)
Cash flow reconciliation (beginning + net change = ending cash)
Cross-statement consistency checks
Outlier detection vs. historical trends
Compare against industry benchmarks for reasonableness
Flag low-confidence extractions for human review
Generate validation report with confidence scores

stages.name: Output & Distribution
stages.description: Deliver extracted data in requested format
ai_tasks: Generate Excel output with formatted financial model template
Provide API response in JSON/XML format
Push directly to financial modeling platforms (Excel add-in)
Generate comparison tables across multiple companies
Create visual charts for key financial metrics
Store in historical database for time-series queries

human_review_checkpoints: Stage 4 only: Review items flagged as low-confidence or with validation failures (typically <5% of extractions)

kpis.accuracy_target: 96%+ line item extraction accuracy, 99%+ calculation accuracy

build_order.rationale: Service-first approach. High cash flow ($5k/deal), zero tech risk (Human-in-the-loop). Generates the training data needed for SaaS.
Recurring revenue container ($2k/mo) + huge success fee upside. High leverage data product.
Productize the internal tools built in Phases 1 & 2. Sell to other developers/firms once battle-tested.
Expansion modules once the core brand is established and profitable.
